text: by responding to data in near real time
today's applications can deliver
powerful interactive experiences new
item recommendations based on recent
searches alerts about potentially
fraudulent transactions game adaptations
during game playay to do this
applications collect and process data as
it's generated then use the data to
update application experiences and
engage users in near real time this can
deliver great user experiences but
building the backend infrastructure to
do the data collection and processing
can be really hard it requires
provisioning and managing a fleet of
servers to buffer and batch the data
arriving from hundreds of thousands of
sources simultaneously if one of those
servers goes down or something goes
wrong in the data stream you can lose
data and that great user experience can
become not so great Amazon Kinesis fire
hose helps make sure that doesn't happen
by making it easy for you to collect and
process streaming data reliably as easy
as a few clicks in the a WS Management
console fire host scales automatically
as volume and throughput varies and
takes care of stream management
including batching compressing
encrypting and loading the data to
Amazon red shift Kinesis analytics S3
and Amazon elastic search service
without you building custom streaming
applications or managing infrastructure
plus there's no minimum fee or setup
cost so you pay only for the data you
transmit by letting you injust streaming
data quickly and automating
administration tasks fire hose frees you
to focus on your application and on
delivering great realtime user
experiences to learn more about Amazon
Kinesis fire hose visit aws.amazon.com
Kinesis firose and get your first data
stream up and running with just a few
clicks
